chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Vincent M Scrima was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid as a condition of probation on case 2014CM1605.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of Delafield Police Dept. Costs to be paid as a condition of probation on case 2014CM01605.

With Huber. Release for standard conditions including Elder Care. Commencing forthwith. Sentence credit of 23 days were granted.  To Comply with Day Report Center from case 14CM1605 consecutive to Huber sentence.
Consecutive to: Case 14CM1605
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

Perform Alcohol Assessment. 
ATTEND: The Victim Impact Panel meeting on 06/17/2015 or serve penalty of 30 days Huber, consecutive for non-attendance.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.  **no paper copy in physical file**

Defendant Vincent M Scrima in court, in custody, with Attorney Nicole M Masnica.   Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #3.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #3.  Count #5 is dismissed by operation of law.  Count #1, 2 and 4 are dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Masnica makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #3:  HUBER:  60 days (23 days credit), Huber with standard release conditions.  Defendant already in custody.   **Consecutive to any other sentence**

FINE: $1,179.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be as a condition of probation as set forth in Case #14CM1605)

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to City of Delafield Police Department. 

DL REVOCATION: 14 months

IGNITION INTERLOCK: 14 months

Victim Impact Panel on:  6/17/15. Defendant to serve 30 days huber, consecutive, as penalty for failure to attend Victim Impact Panel.

Other:  AODA ASSESSMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH

NOTE:  Cash bail posted is to be returned to person who posted it.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 3, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on July 23, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.    Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.   Defendant to be released directly/only to Wisconsin Community Services personnel to set-up SCRAM monitoring. NOTE:  Defendant has already posted $500.00.

Defendant Vincent M Scrima in court with Attorney Nicole M Masnica.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Becky Van Dam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court quashes warrant.  Attorney Masnica requests an adjourned date.  Court addresses WCS letter.  Attorney Masnica makes statements regarding WCS letter/report.  State requests an increase in cash bail.  Court increases cash bail.  Hearing scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 10:30 am.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Nicole M Masnica in court.   Defendant Vincent M Scrima did not appear.   Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called at 11:16 am. Clerk and Attorney attempted to call the Defendant. Defendant does not appear. Warrants on all cases will remain.
Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture

Attorney Nicole M Masnica in court.   Defendant Vincent M Scrima did not appear.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern Becky Van Dam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Masnica does not know why Defendant does not appear today.  Warrant remains outstanding.  Court revokes and forfeits bail.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.  **no paper copy in physical file**
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.

Non compliance with WCS. 
Br. 4 only.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.  **no paper copy in physical file**

Attorney Masnica requests one more additional further proceedings date due to new charges.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 10:00 am.
